update tbl_transaction
owner = #{owner,jdbcType=CHAR},

where id = #{id,jdbcType=CHAR}

mapper.insert: insert into tbl_transaction(id, owner, money, name, expected_date, customer_id, stage, type, source, activity_id, contacts_id, create_by, create_time, description, contact_summary, next_contact_time) VALUES (#{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{owner,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{money,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{expectedDate,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{customer.id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{stage,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{type,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{source,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{activity.id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{contacts.id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{createBy,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{createTime,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{description,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{ contactSummary,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{nextContactTime,jdbcType=VARCHAR})
mapper.select: select tr.id, tr.name, tr.money, user1.name as owner, tr.expected_date, tr.customer_id, dicv1.value as stage, dicv2.value as type, dicv3.value as source, tr.activity_id, tr.contacts_id, user2.name as create_by, tr.create_time, user3.name as edit_by, tr.edit_time, tr.description, tr.contact_summary, tr.next_contact_time from tbl_transaction tr join tbl_user user1 on user1.id = tr.owner join tbl_user user2 on user2.id = tr.create_by join tbl_customer cust on cust.id = tr.customer_id join tbl_dic_value dicv1 on dicv1.id = tr.stage join tbl_dic_value dicv2 on dicv2.id = tr.type join tbl_dic_value dicv3 on dicv3.id = tr.source join tbl_activity act on act.id = tr.activity_id join tbl_contacts cont on cont.id = tr.contacts_id left join tbl_user user3 on tr.edit_by = user3.id where tr.id = #{transactionId,jdbcType=VARCHAR};
